intro: Gochnatia microcephala var. buchii, commonly known as the narrow-headed gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, hairy fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
